revised_title: Investigation of the Emission of the Negative System of Nitrogen from the Upper Atmosphere and the Significance of the Twilight Flash in Ionosphere Theory
tldr: The authors investigate the cause of the emission of the negative system of nitrogen from the upper atmosphere during twilight and its significance in ionosphere theory. They study two possible excitation mechanisms and conclude that one is far more effective than the other. The authors also discuss the significance of the twilight flash and its correlation with magnetic activity and aurorae. They suggest further research to better understand the ionization mechanisms and the role of charged particles in the ionosphere.
